subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Limits of Water Power
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Limits of Water Power.

hook.text: Hydropower sounds perfect. But the best rivers are already dammed.

buildup.text: There are over 60,000 large dams on Earth. Most suitable sites are taken.

discovery.text: Climate change is altering rainfall, making some reservoirs unreliable for the first time.

twist.text: Severe droughts have forced hydro-dependent countries to ration electricity.

climax.text: Run-of-river systems skip dams entirely and use natural flow â€” lower impact, less storage.

punchline.text: Water power is renewable. The rivers that feed it may not be.

quiz.question: Why is hydropower becoming less reliable in some regions?
options: Climate change is altering rainfall patterns
